level.heading: TIME AND MATERIALS CONTRACTS AND LABOR HOURS CONTRACTS (ยง 27-4616)

level.text: Time-and-materials contracts provide for acquiring supplies or services on the basis of:
Direct labor hours charged at fixed hourly rates that include overhead and profit; and
Materials (which may be charged either at their actual cost or at fixed unit prices).
A labor hours contract is a time-and-materials contract that does not involve materials.
Both time-and-materials contracts and labor hours contracts should specify a ceiling price.

Source: Notice of Emergency and Proposed Rulemaking published at 57 DCR 8507 (October 8, 2010)[EXPIRED]; as amended by Notice of Emergency and Proposed Rulemaking published at 58 DCR 3086 (April 18, 2011)[EXPIRED]; as amended by Notice of Final Rulemaking published at 58 DCR 4565, 4583 (May 27, 2011).
